resources.string: Created by Phil Wagner of the education blog BrokenAirplane

Accelerometer:

Data is collected every 100 ms

X - rotating left to right (roll)
Y - rotating top to bottom (pitch)
Z - moving up or down relative to the Earth (azimuth)

Use it on a rollercoaster or to measure forces and acceleration.

PhysicsGizmo Instructions:
1. Select your sensor
2. Give your data a name or leave it with the time and date.
3. Set the timer.
4. Click start to collect data.
5. Upload your data to analyze later (saved in the ScienceData folder on the SD card).

Pulse photogate:

An event is triggered each time the proximity sensor (usually in the upper left of the phone) is covered.

Use it to count events.

PhysicsGizmo Instructions:
1. Select your sensor
2. Give your data a name or leave it with the time and date.
3. Set the timer.
4. Click start to collect data.
5. Upload your data to analyze later (saved in the ScienceData folder on the SD card).

Pulse photogate with 2 phones:

1. Click yes to turn on Bluetooth Discovery mode.
2. Select another phone running Physics Gizmo from the list.
3. The timer starts when the first phone's proximity sensor (usually in the upper left of the phone) is triggered.
4.The timer stops when the second phone's proximity sensor is triggered.

Use it to see how long it takes for an object to fall or roll down a ramp like Galileo's experiment.

Bluetooth range ~30 ft/10 m

Pendulum photogate:

An event is triggered for each completed full swing/period of a pendulum passing by the proximity sensor (usually in the upper left of the phone).
